songs.full_title: The Christmas Song (Merry Christmas to You) (Original 1946 Version) by The Nat “King” Cole Trio
songs.title: The Christmas Song (Merry Christmas to You) (Original 1946 Version)
songs.title_with_featured: The Christmas Song (Merry Christmas to You) (Original 1946 Version)

description.plain:
This is the original version of “The Christmas Song (Merry Christmas to You).” With only piano, bass, and guitar as backing for Nat King Cole, it creates an intimate atmosphere.

It’s also the only version of the song to include the phrase “reindeers,” as Cole fixed the grammatical error to “reindeer” in all subsequent releases of the song. The Nat King Cole Trio would go on to rerecord the song and rerelease it within the same year with additional musical backing. They would rerelease it in [1953] (https://genius.com/Nat-king-cole-the-christmas-song-1953-version-lyrics) and 1961 as well.

body.plain:
This is the original version of “The Christmas Song (Merry Christmas to You).” With only piano, bass, and guitar as backing for Nat King Cole, it creates an intimate atmosphere.

It’s also the only version of the song to include the phrase “reindeers,” as Cole fixed the grammatical error to “reindeer” in all subsequent releases of the song. The Nat King Cole Trio would go on to rerecord the song and rerelease it within the same year with additional musical backing. They would rerelease it in [1953] (https://genius.com/Nat-king-cole-the-christmas-song-1953-version-lyrics) and 1961 as well.

songs.full_title: The Christmas Song (1953 Version) by Nat King Cole
songs.title: The Christmas Song (1953 Version)

songs.lyrics:
6 ContributorsThe Christmas Song (Merry Christmas to You) (Original 1946 Version) Lyrics[Verse]
Chestnuts roasting on an open fire
Jack frost nipping at your nose
Yuletide carols being sung by a choir
And folks dressed up like Eskimos

Everybody knows a turkey and some mistletoe
Help to make the season bright
Tiny tots with their eyes all aglow
Will find it hard to sleep tonight
They know that Santa's on his way
He's loaded lots of toys and goodies on his sleigh
And every mother's child is gonna spy
To see if reindeers really know how to fly

And so I'm offering this simple phrase
To kids from one to ninety-two
Although its been said many times
Many ways, merry Christmas to you

[Instrumental break]

[Outro]
And so I'm offering this simple phrase
To kids from one to ninety-two
Although its been said many times
Many ways, merry Christmas to youYou might also likeEmbed

songs.lyrics:
2 ContributorsNature Boy LyricsThere was a boy
A very strange enchanted boy
They say he wandered very far
Very far
Over land and sea
A little shy and sad of eye
But very wise was he

And then one day
A magic day he passed my way
And while we spoke of many things
Fools and kings
This he said to me
"The greatest thing you'll ever learn
Is just to love and be loved in return"
"The greatest thing you'll ever learn
Is just to love and be loved in return"You might also like1Embed

songs.lyrics:
4 ContributorsIt’s Only a Paper Moon LyricsIt is only a paper moon
Sailing over a cardboard sea
But it wouldn't be make-believe
If you believe in me

It is only a canvas sky
Hanging over a muslin tree
But it wouldn't be make-believe
If you believe in me

Without your love
It's a honky-tonk parade
Without your love
It's a melody played
In a penny arcade
It's a Barnum and Bailey world
Just as phony as it can be
But it wouldn't be make-believe
If you believe in me

Without your love
It's a honky-tonk parade
Without your love
It's a melody played
In a penny arcade

It's a Barnum and Bailey world
Just as phony as it can be
But it wouldn't be make-believe
If you believe in meYou might also likeEmbed
